Compute
\[\sum_{1 \le j < i} \frac{1}{2^{i + j}},\]where the sum is taken over all positive integers $i$ and $j$ such that $1 \le j < i.$
inference:
We have the sum
\[\sum_{1 \le j < i} \frac{1}{2^{i + j}} = \sum_{i = 2}^{\infty} \sum_{j = 1}^{i - 1} \frac{1}{2^{i + j}} = \sum_{i = 2}^{\infty} \frac{1}{2^i} \sum_{j = 1}^{i - 1} \frac{1}{2^j}.\]By the formula for a finite geometric series,
\[\sum_{j = 1}^{i - 1} \frac{1}{2^j} = \frac{1/2 - (1/2)^{i}}{1 - 1/2} = 2 \left( \frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{2^i} \right) = 1 - \frac{1}{2^{i - 1}} = 1 - \frac{1}{2^{i - 1}}.\]Therefore,
\begin{align*} \sum_{i = 2}^{\infty} \sum_{j = 1}^{i - 1} \frac{1}{2^{i + j}} &= \sum_{i = 2}^{\infty} \frac{1}{2^i} \sum_{j = 1}^{i - 1} \frac{1}{2^j} \\ &= \sum_{i = 2}^{\infty} \frac{1}{2^i} \left( 1 - \frac{1}{2^{i - 1}} \right) \\ &= \sum_{i = 2}^{\infty} \frac{1}{2^i} - \sum_{i = 2}^{\infty} \frac{1}{2^{2i - 1}} \\ &= \sum_{i = 2}^{\infty} \frac{1}{2^i} - \sum_{i = 2}^{\infty} \frac{1}{2^{2i - 1}}. \end{align*}The first series is
\[ \sum_{i = 2}^{\infty} \frac{1}{2^i} = \frac{1/4}{1 - 1/2} = \frac{1}{4} \cdot 2 = \frac{1}{2}. \]The second series is
\[\sum_{i = 2}^{\infty} \frac{1}{2^{2i - 1}} = \frac{1/2^3}{1 - 1/4} = \frac{1/8}{3/4} = \frac{1}{6}. \]Thus, the original sum is
\[\frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{6} = \frac{3}{6} - \frac{1}{6} = \frac{2}{6} = \frac{1}{3}.\]Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{1}{3}}$

We have that
\begin{align*}
\sum_{1 \le j < i} \frac{1}{2^{i + j}} &= \sum_{j = 1}^\infty \sum_{i = j + 1}^\infty \frac{1}{2^{i + j}} \\
&= \sum_{j = 1}^\infty \frac{1}{2^j} \sum_{i = j + 1}^\infty \frac{1}{2^i} \\
&= \sum_{j = 1}^\infty \frac{1}{2^j} \left( \frac{1}{2^{j + 1}} + \frac{1}{2^{j + 2}} + \frac{1}{2^{j + 3}} + \dotsb \right) \\
&= \sum_{j = 1}^\infty \frac{1}{2^j} \cdot \frac{1/2^{j + 1}}{1 - 1/2} \\
&= \sum_{j = 1}^\infty \frac{1}{2^j} \cdot \frac{1}{2^j} \\
&= \sum_{j = 1}^\infty \frac{1}{4^j} \\
&= \frac{1/4}{1 - 1/4} \\
&= \boxed{\frac{1}{3}}.
\end{align*}
